question: Which of the following represents angular frequency of a body?
option1: twice the frequency of the body
option2: product of frequency of the body with π
option3: half the frequency of the body
option4: product of frequency of the body with 3 π
answer: twice the frequency of the body
explanation: Angular frequency of a body executing periodic motion is equal to product of frequency of the body with factor 2π. Angular frequency = 2 π n The unit of Angular frequency will be rad per second.
